title: Damage type
data:
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ ]## Contents* [1 Cancellation and damage types](#Cancellation_and_damage_types)
* [2 Magic cancellation and damage types](#Magic_cancellation_and_damage_types)
* [3 List of damage types](#List_of_damage_types)
* [4 History](#History)
* [5 References](#References) |

Every attack in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* has a defined **damage type** that determines how the attack of a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") or character affects the target when it hits.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) This is distinct from the [attack type](/index.php?title=Attack_type\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Attack type (page does not exist)"), which determines how that attack makes contact with the target. Many damage types naturally deal [hit point](/wiki/Hit_point "Hit point") damage, and several have additional effects beyond that damage, which can include inflicting status [properties](/wiki/Properties "Properties") on the target or affecting items in their open inventory—several do not deal hit point damage, and will instead apply different effects depending on the damage type.

[Magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") can negate the effects of some damage types, and the attacks of [cancelled](/wiki/Cancellation#Cancellation_of_monsters "Cancellation") monsters with certain damage types will have no effect.

## Cancellation and damage types

If the attacker is cancelled, then several attack types are blocked, and most special damage types are blocked—cancellation is effective if *either* the attack type *or* the damage type are blocked. For example, if a dragon is cancelled, its breath attack cannot be used and will do no damage, regardless of the damage type.

These damage types are *not* blocked: ordinary physical damage, magic missile, disintegration, digestion, drain intelligence, illness, the [Riders](/wiki/Riders "Riders")' special damage types, and the Amulet-stealing damage type.

## Magic cancellation and damage types

[Magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") (not to be confused with cancellation) has a probability of blocking the effects of certain attack and damage types, and is only effective if the attack has *both* an eligible [attack type](/index.php?title=Attack_type\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Attack type (page does not exist)") *and* an eligible damage type. And even then, there is only a probability of blocking the attack.

These damage types are eligible for magic cancellation: fire, cold, sleep, shock, poison (versus strength, versus dexterity and versus constitution), slow, paralysis, drain life, drain energy, sticking, teleport, lycanthropy, sliming, and disenchanting.

## List of damage types

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Linkify the remaining unlinked attack types, creating articles where necessary."*

Below is a list of damage types and their effects, as well as whether or not they are affected by cancellation or magic cancellation:

| ID                        | Name                                                                                                   | Blocked by                                                                                                                                                      | Effects                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | Example monsters                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| AD\_PHYS                  | [Physical damage](/wiki/Physical_damage "Physical damage")                                             | [Armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") *(partial)*, [Half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage") *(half)*                                    | Deals ordinary physical damage. The most common type.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | [jackal](/wiki/Jackal "Jackal"), [hill giant](/wiki/Hill_giant "Hill giant")                                                                                                                 |
| AD\_MAGM                  | [Magic missile](/wiki/Magic_missile "Magic missile")                                                   | [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance")                                                                                                   | A blast of missiles.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | [gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon"), [Angel](/wiki/Angel "Angel")                                                                                                                 |
| AD\_FIRE                  | [Fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire")                                                                              | [Fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") *(HP damage)*                                                                                        | May burn up scrolls, potions, spellbooks, and globs of green slime in the defender's inventory. [Passive](/wiki/Passive "Passive") fire damage may burn the attacker's weapon. Burns away [slime](/wiki/Slime "Slime").                                                                                                                                             | [fire ant](/wiki/Fire_ant "Fire ant"), [red naga](/wiki/Red_naga "Red naga")                                                                                                                 |
| AD\_COLD                  | [Cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold")                                                                              | [Cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") *(HP damage)*                                                                                        | May freeze and shatter potions in the defender's inventory.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | [winter wolf](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf"), [freezing sphere](/wiki/Freezing_sphere "Freezing sphere")                                                                                   |
| AD\_SLEE                  | [Sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep")                                                                           | [Sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance")                                                                                                   | No hit point damage. Puts the defender to sleep.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | *only* [homunculus](/wiki/Homunculus "Homunculus"), [orange dragon](/wiki/Orange_dragon "Orange dragon"), [Nazgul](/wiki/Nazgul "Nazgul")                                                    |
| AD\_DISN                  | [Disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration")                                                | [Disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance")                                                                        | No hit point damage. This disintegrates the defenders's worn [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") if applicable, or disintegrates the defender's worn [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") and [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") if applicable, and otherwise causes instadeath.                                                                                       | *only* [black dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon")                                                                                                                                     |
| AD\_ELEC                  | [Shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock")                                                                           | [Shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance") *(HP damage)*                                                                                     | May explode wands and rings in inventory.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | [blue dragon](/wiki/Blue_dragon "Blue dragon"), [grid bug](/wiki/Grid_bug "Grid bug")                                                                                                        |
| AD\_DRST                  | [Poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") vs [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength")                               | [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")                                                                                                | The most common type of poison. It may lower [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), and has a chance of causing instadeath. Against monsters, it may cause an instadeath.                                                                                                                                                                                           | [green dragon](/wiki/Green_dragon "Green dragon"), [soldier ant](/wiki/Soldier_ant "Soldier ant"), [snake](/wiki/Snake "Snake")                                                              |
| AD\_ACID                  | [Acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid")                                                                              | [Acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") *(HP damage)*                                                                                        | On passive attacks, this may also [corrode](/wiki/Corrode "Corrode") worn or wielded items.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | [acid blob](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob"), [yellow dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon"), [ochre jelly](/wiki/Ochre_jelly "Ochre jelly")                                               |
| AD\_BLND                  | [Blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind")                                                                           |                                                                                                                                                                 | No hit point damage. Blinds the defender. For some [attack types](/index.php?title=Attack_type\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Attack type (page does not exist)"), cancelling the attacker blocks this damage type; for others, a [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold") or certain other equipment blocks this damage type.                                            | [yellow light](/wiki/Yellow_light "Yellow light"), [dust vortex](/wiki/Dust_vortex "Dust vortex"), [Archon](/wiki/Archon "Archon")                                                           |
| AD\_STUN                  | [Stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun")                                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                 | Stuns the defender.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | *only* [yellow mold](/wiki/Yellow_mold "Yellow mold"), [abbot](/wiki/Abbot "Abbot"), [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub")                                                                |
| AD\_SLOW                  | [Slow](/wiki/Slowing_attack "Slowing attack")                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                 | Deals no extra hit point damage and slows the defender.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | *only* [skeleton](/wiki/Skeleton "Skeleton"), [shade](/wiki/Shade "Shade")                                                                                                                   |
| AD\_PLYS                  | [Paralysis](/wiki/Paralysis "Paralysis")                                                               | [Free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action")                                                                                                                  | Deals no extra hit point damage and can paralyze the defender.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye"), [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube"), [shade](/wiki/Shade "Shade")                                                  |
| AD\_DRLI                  | [Drain life](/wiki/Drain_life_\(monster_attack\) "Drain life (monster attack)")                        | [Drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance")                                                                                                   | Drains a level from the defender. May cause instadeath if the defender is drained below level 1.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire"), [barrow wight](/wiki/Barrow_wight "Barrow wight"), [wraith](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith")                                                                       |
| AD\_DREN                  | Drain energy                                                                                           |                                                                                                                                                                 | No hit point damage. Against the hero, this drains [power](/wiki/Power "Power"), and then drains maximum power if their current power is 0. [Magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") blocks this attack unless the hero is engulfed. Against a monster, it prevents them from using magical attacks or breath weapons for several turns. | *only* [energy vortex](/wiki/Energy_vortex "Energy vortex")                                                                                                                                  |
| AD\_LEGS                  | [Wounded legs](/wiki/Wounded_legs "Wounded legs")                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                 | Certain [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") have a probability of blocking HP damage. Against the hero, it causes [wounded legs](/wiki/Wounded_legs "Wounded legs"). Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage.                                                                                                                                                 | *only* [xan](/wiki/Xan "Xan")                                                                                                                                                                |
| AD\_STON (touch attack)   | [Stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning")                                                                     | [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance")                                                                                             | No hit point damage. Delayed instadeath by stoning.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | *only* [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice"), [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")                                                                                           |

Instadeath by stoning.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | *only* [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice"), [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice")                                                                                           |
| AD\_STON (gaze attack)    | [Stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning")                                                                     | [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"), [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness"), or [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection")   | No hit point damage. Instadeath by stoning.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | *only* [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa")                                                                                                                                                       |

| AD\_SGLD                  | [Steal gold](/wiki/Steal_gold "Steal gold")                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                 | The attacker steals some or all of the defender's gold, then teleports if the theft is successful. On the second hit, if the attacker is in water, the hero [drowns](/wiki/Drown "Drown") in an instadeath. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | *only* [werecreatures](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature")                                                                                                                                    |

Against a monster, it deals HP damage and may cause instadeath.                                                                                                                                                                                    | *only* [quasit](/wiki/Quasit "Quasit")                                                                                                                                                       |
| AD\_DRCO                  | [Poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") vs [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution")                   | [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")                                                                                                | Against the hero, it may lower [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"), may cause instadeath. Against a monster, it deals HP damage, and deals extra damage if the defender is not [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless").              | *only* [mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer"), [master mind flayer](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer")                                                                   |
| AD\_DISE                  | [Illness](/wiki/Illness "Illness")                                                                     | [Immunity to sickness](/wiki/Immunity_to_sickness "Immunity to sickness")                                                                                       | Against the hero, it causes illness, which may cause delayed instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | *only* [Scorpius](/wiki/Scorpius "Scorpius"), [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex"), [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")                                                                |
| AD\_DCAY                  | [Rot](/wiki/Rot "Rot")                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                 | Against the hero and monsters, it rots a random piece of worn armor; as a passive attack, it rots the item that made contact. Instadeath for [wood golems](/wiki/Wood_golem "Wood golem") and [leather golems](/wiki/Leather_golem "Leather golem").                                                                                                                | *only* [brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding")                                                                                                                                  |

Against the hero, it initiates a seduction attack; this is changed to AD\_DRLI if [sysconf](/wiki/Sysconf "Sysconf") option SEDUCE is not set. May cause an indirect instadeath under certain circumstances by removing certain armor or [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring"). Against a monster, it behaves the same as a normal item-stealing attack.  | *only* [incubus](/wiki/Incubus "Incubus") and [succubus](/wiki/Succubus "Succubus")                                                                                                          |
| AD\_HALU                  | [Hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination")                                                   | [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") or [hallucination resistance](/wiki/Hallucination_resistance "Hallucination resistance")                               | No hit point damage. Against the hero, it causes hallucination. Against a monster, it causes [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion").                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | *only* [black light](/wiki/Black_light "Black light")                                                                                                                                        |
| AD\_DETH                  | [Death](/wiki/Riders#Death "Riders")'s special attack                                                  | [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") *(instadeath)*                                                                                    | Against the hero, it deals damage to both current and maximum hit points, and may cause an instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect.                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | *only* [Death](/wiki/Death "Death")                                                                                                                                                          |
| AD\_PEST                  | [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence")'s special attack                                           | [Immunity to sickness](/wiki/Immunity_to_sickness "Immunity to sickness")                                                                                       | Against the hero, it causes [illness](/wiki/Illness "Illness"), which may cause a delayed instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect.                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | *only* [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence")                                                                                                                                           |
| AD\_FAMN                  | [Famine](/wiki/Famine "Famine")'s special attack                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                 | Against the hero, it drains [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"), but not if the hero is already fainting, and abuses [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"). Against a monster, it has no effect.                                                                                                                                                   | *only* [Famine](/wiki/Famine "Famine")                                                                                                                                                       |
| AD\_SLIM                  | [Sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming")                                                                     | [Unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging")                                                                                                                     | Against the hero, it may cause delayed instadeath by sliming. Against a monster, it may cause an instant transformation into a green slime.                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | *only* [green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime")                                                                                                                                        |
| AD\_ENCH                  | Disenchanting                                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                 | Against the hero, it attempts to disenchant one item. As a passive attack, it disenchants the item that made contact. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage.                                                                                                                                                                                         | *only* [disenchanter](/wiki/Disenchanter "Disenchanter")                                                                                                                                     |
| AD\_CORR                  | [Corrosion](/wiki/Corrosion "Corrosion")                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                 | Corrodes one item. As a passive attack, it corrodes the item that made contact.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | *only* [black pudding](/wiki/Black_pudding "Black pudding")                                                                                                                                  |
| AD\_CLRC                  | [Clerical spell](/wiki/Monster_spell#Clerical_spells "Monster spell")                                  |                                                                                                                                                                 | Against the hero, the attacker casts a clerical spell appropriate to the attacker's level. Against a monster, it has no effect.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest"), [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest"), [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen")                                      |
| AD\_SPEL                  | [Mage spell](/wiki/Monster_spell#Mage_spells "Monster spell")                                          |                                                                                                                                                                 | Against the hero, the attacker casts a mage spell appropriate to the attacker's level, which may include the [touch of death](/wiki/Touch_of_death "Touch of death"). Against a monster, it has no effect.                                                                                                                                                          | [lich](/wiki/Lich "Lich"), [orc shaman](/wiki/Orc_shaman "Orc shaman"), [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")                                                        |
| AD\_RBRE                  | Random [breath weapon](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon")                                            |                                                                                                                                                                 | This damage type resolves to a random damage type between AD\_MAGM and AD\_ACID.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | *only* the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon")                                                                                                                     |
| AD\_SAMU                  | Steal the Amulet                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                 | Against the hero, the attacker steals a valuable item such as the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), any other [unique item](/wiki/Unique_item "Unique item"), or any [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"). Against a monster, it has no effect.                                                                     | *only* [quest nemeses](/wiki/Quest_nemeses "Quest nemeses"), the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")                                                               |
| AD\_CURS                  | Steal intrinsic                                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                 | Against the hero, it removes a random [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") from them. Against a monster, it may cancel the defender. Instadeath for [clay golems](/wiki/Clay_golem "Clay golem").                                                                                                                                                               | *only* [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin")                                                                                                                                                    |

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Extrinsic properties that resist a given damage type protect the target's inventory from that damage 99⁄100 of the time, and a worn [dwarvish cloak](/wiki/Dwarvish_cloak "Dwarvish cloak") prevents inventory damage from fire and cold attacks 9⁄10 of the time.

Per [commit 017a8687](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/017a8687e0b541a8e5848ef3037e25dc819208ca), the illness attack types and the attack types unique to each Rider are made functional in monster-to-monster combat.

## History

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation_\(3.4.3\) "Magic cancellation (3.4.3)") has higher probabilities for blocking the effects of certain damage types - in particular, MC3 blocks 49⁄50 or 98% of damage types that it affects, making it an incredibly desirable and reliable property to have.

[NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") introduces the current magic cancellation system and applies the following changes to damage types:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- [Half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage") blocks more instances of physical damage than it did in NetHack 3.4.3.
- Grease protects against all types of [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion").
- [Passive](/wiki/Passive "Passive") fire damage may burn the attacker's weapon.
- Passive attacks no longer erode armor covered by other armor.
- `AD_DREN` implemented, actually draining energy (energy vortices).

[NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1") applies the following changes to damage types:[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

- The `AD_SAMU` damage type is given the ability to take any quest artifact, rather than just the one corresponding to the hero's role.

[NetHack 3.6.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.2 "NetHack 3.6.2") applies the following changes to damage types:[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

- If hero survives [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming") via [lifesaving](/wiki/Lifesaving "Lifesaving"), hero continues adventuring in slime form.
- If `AD_TLPT` succeeds in teleporting, hit point damage is limited so that defender will not die from hit point loss.

[NetHack 3.6.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.3 "NetHack 3.6.3") applies the following changes to damage types:[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

- `AD_LEGS` no longer fails to deal damage against a target that is [flying](/wiki/Flying "Flying"), [levitating](/wiki/Levitating "Levitating") or [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") as in previous versions.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monattk.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 31](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monattk.h#L31)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [doc/fixes36.0 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/doc/fixes36.0#L1)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [doc/fixes36.1 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/doc/fixes36.1#L1)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [doc/fixes36.2 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/doc/fixes36.2#L1)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [doc/fixes36.3 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/doc/fixes36.3#L1)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Damage type

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Contents

  • 1 Cancellation and damage types
  • 2 Magic cancellation and damage types
  • 3 List of damage types
  • 4 History
  • 5 References

Every attack in NetHack has a defined damage type that determines how the attack of a monster or character affects the target when it hits.[1] This is distinct from the attack type, which determines how that attack makes contact with the target. Many damage types naturally deal hit point damage, and several have additional effects beyond that damage, which can include inflicting status properties on the target or affecting items in their open inventory—several do not deal hit point damage, and will instead apply different effects depending on the damage type.

Magic cancellation can negate the effects of some damage types, and the attacks of cancelled monsters with certain damage types will have no effect.

Cancellation and damage types

If the attacker is cancelled, then several attack types are blocked, and most special damage types are blocked—cancellation is effective if either the attack type or the damage type are blocked. For example, if a dragon is cancelled, its breath attack cannot be used and will do no damage, regardless of the damage type.

These damage types are not blocked: ordinary physical damage, magic missile, disintegration, digestion, drain intelligence, illness, the Riders' special damage types, and the Amulet-stealing damage type.

Magic cancellation and damage types

Magic cancellation (not to be confused with cancellation) has a probability of blocking the effects of certain attack and damage types, and is only effective if the attack has both an eligible attack type and an eligible damage type. And even then, there is only a probability of blocking the attack.

These damage types are eligible for magic cancellation: fire, cold, sleep, shock, poison (versus strength, versus dexterity and versus constitution), slow, paralysis, drain life, drain energy, sticking, teleport, lycanthropy, sliming, and disenchanting.

List of damage types

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Linkify the remaining unlinked attack types, creating articles where necessary."

Below is a list of damage types and their effects, as well as whether or not they are affected by cancellation or magic cancellation:

List of damage types
ID Name Blocked by Effects Example monsters
AD_PHYS Physical damage Armor (partial), Half physical damage (half) Deals ordinary physical damage. The most common type. jackal, hill giant
AD_MAGM Magic missile Magic resistance A blast of missiles. gray dragon, Angel
AD_FIRE Fire Fire resistance (HP damage) May burn up scrolls, potions, spellbooks, and globs of green slime in the defender's inventory. Passive fire damage may burn the attacker's weapon. Burns away slime. fire ant, red naga
AD_COLD Cold Cold resistance (HP damage) May freeze and shatter potions in the defender's inventory. winter wolf, freezing sphere
AD_SLEE Sleep Sleep resistance No hit point damage. Puts the defender to sleep. only homunculus, orange dragon, Nazgul
AD_DISN Disintegration Disintegration resistance No hit point damage. This disintegrates the defenders's worn shield if applicable, or disintegrates the defender's worn cloak and body armor if applicable, and otherwise causes instadeath. only black dragon
AD_ELEC Shock Shock resistance (HP damage) May explode wands and rings in inventory. blue dragon, grid bug
AD_DRST Poison vs strength Poison resistance The most common type of poison. It may lower strength, and has a chance of causing instadeath. Against monsters, it may cause an instadeath. green dragon, soldier ant, snake
AD_ACID Acid Acid resistance (HP damage) On passive attacks, this may also corrode worn or wielded items. acid blob, yellow dragon, ochre jelly
AD_BLND Blind No hit point damage. Blinds the defender. For some attack types, cancelling the attacker blocks this damage type; for others, a blindfold or certain other equipment blocks this damage type. yellow light, dust vortex, Archon
AD_STUN Stun Stuns the defender. only yellow mold, abbot, Baalzebub
AD_SLOW Slow Deals no extra hit point damage and slows the defender. only skeleton, shade
AD_PLYS Paralysis Free action Deals no extra hit point damage and can paralyze the defender. floating eye, gelatinous cube, shade
AD_DRLI Drain life Drain resistance Drains a level from the defender. May cause instadeath if the defender is drained below level 1. vampire, barrow wight, wraith
AD_DREN Drain energy No hit point damage. Against the hero, this drains power, and then drains maximum power if their current power is 0. Magic cancellation blocks this attack unless the hero is engulfed. Against a monster, it prevents them from using magical attacks or breath weapons for several turns. only energy vortex
AD_LEGS Wounded legs Certain boots have a probability of blocking HP damage. Against the hero, it causes wounded legs. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. only xan
AD_STON (touch attack) Stoning stoning resistance No hit point damage. Delayed instadeath by stoning. only chickatrice, cockatrice
AD_STON (passive attack) Stoning stoning resistance, gloves (if punching) or boots (if kicking) No hit point damage. Instadeath by stoning. only chickatrice, cockatrice
AD_STON (gaze attack) Stoning stoning resistance, blindness, or reflection No hit point damage. Instadeath by stoning. only Medusa
AD_STCK Sticking Against the hero, this deals no additional hit point damage, but causes them to stick to the attacker, and prevents them from moving off their current square until the attacker dies or otherwise releases them. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. only lichen, violet fungus, large mimic, giant mimic
AD_SGLD Steal gold The attacker steals some or all of the defender's gold, then teleports if the theft is successful. Against the hero, the attacker may also snatch the gold that the hero was standing on. only leprechaun
AD_SITM Steal one item Deals no hit point damage and steals one item from the defender, followed by the attacker teleporting and/or fleeing. only monkey, nymph
AD_SEDU Steal multiple items Deals no hit point damage and steals multiple items. Not to be confused with AD_SSEX or AD_SAMU. only nymph
AD_TLPT Teleport The defender is teleported to a random tile on this level, subject to teleport control, unless the level is no-teleport. HP damage is limited so that it will not kill the defender. only quantum mechanic
AD_RUST Rust Causes a random piece of worn armor to rust, which may fail if it is blessed, rustproof or not rustable. As a passive attack, it tries to rust the gear that made contact. Instadeath for iron golems. only gray ooze, rust monster
AD_CONF Confusion Deals no hit point damage and confuses the defender. only umber hulk, Yeenoghu
AD_DGST Digestion Slow digestion Against the hero, it engulfs them and starts a delayed instadeath. Against a monster, it is an immediate instadeath if they are small enough, and otherwise deals physical damage. only trapper, lurker above, purple worm
AD_HEAL Healing Against the hero, it deals physical damage unless they are wearing no armor and wielding no weapon, in which case multiple positive effects occur, including healing the hero and raising their maximum HP. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. only nurse
AD_WRAP holding / Drowning Greased armor or oilskin cloak Against the hero, it grabs on the first hit, the attacker swings itself around the hero. On the second hit, if the attacker is in water, the hero drowns in an instadeath. Against a monster: damage is ordinary physical. eels, kraken, python
AD_WERE Lycanthropy Protection from shape changers or wielding Werebane Against the hero, it causes lycanthropy. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. only werecreatures
AD_DRDX Poison vs dexterity Poison resistance Against the hero, it may lower dexterity, and has a chance of causing instadeath. Against a monster, it deals HP damage and may cause instadeath. only quasit
AD_DRCO Poison vs constitution Poison resistance Against the hero, it may lower constitution, may cause instadeath. Against a monster, it deals HP damage and may cause instadeath. only rabid rat
AD_DRIN Drain intelligence Worn helm (7⁄8 of the time), greased worn helm (always, but may wear off 1⁄2 of the time) Against the hero, it lowers intelligence if not blocked, can additionally cause amnesia, and causes an instadeath if their intelligence is drained enough. Against a monster, it deals HP damage, and deals extra damage if the defender is not mindless. only mind flayer, master mind flayer
AD_DISE Illness Immunity to sickness Against the hero, it causes illness, which may cause delayed instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect. only Scorpius, Juiblex, Demogorgon
AD_DCAY Rot Against the hero and monsters, it rots a random piece of worn armor; as a passive attack, it rots the item that made contact. Instadeath for wood golems and leather golems. only brown pudding
AD_SSEX Seduction No hit point damage. Against the hero, it initiates a seduction attack; this is changed to AD_DRLI if sysconf option SEDUCE is not set. May cause an indirect instadeath under certain circumstances by removing certain armor or rings. Against a monster, it behaves the same as a normal item-stealing attack. only incubus and succubus
AD_HALU Hallucination blindness or hallucination resistance No hit point damage. Against the hero, it causes hallucination. Against a monster, it causes confusion. only black light
AD_DETH Death's special attack Magic resistance (instadeath) Against the hero, it deals damage to both current and maximum hit points, and may cause an instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect. only Death
AD_PEST Pestilence's special attack Immunity to sickness Against the hero, it causes illness, which may cause a delayed instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect. only Pestilence
AD_FAMN Famine's special attack Against the hero, it drains nutrition, but not if the hero is already fainting, and abuses constitution. Against a monster, it has no effect. only Famine
AD_SLIM Sliming Unchanging Against the hero, it may cause delayed instadeath by sliming. Against a monster, it may cause an instant transformation into a green slime. only green slime
AD_ENCH Disenchanting Against the hero, it attempts to disenchant one item. As a passive attack, it disenchants the item that made contact. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. only disenchanter
AD_CORR Corrosion Corrodes one item. As a passive attack, it corrodes the item that made contact. only black pudding
AD_CLRC Clerical spell Against the hero, the attacker casts a clerical spell appropriate to the attacker's level. Against a monster, it has no effect. aligned priest, high priest, Master Kaen
AD_SPEL Mage spell Against the hero, the attacker casts a mage spell appropriate to the attacker's level, which may include the touch of death. Against a monster, it has no effect. lich, orc shaman, Wizard of Yendor
AD_RBRE Random breath weapon This damage type resolves to a random damage type between AD_MAGM and AD_ACID. only the Chromatic Dragon
AD_SAMU Steal the Amulet Against the hero, the attacker steals a valuable item such as the Amulet of Yendor, any other unique item, or any quest artifact. Against a monster, it has no effect. only quest nemeses, the Wizard of Yendor
AD_CURS Steal intrinsic Against the hero, it removes a random intrinsic from them. Against a monster, it may cancel the defender. Instadeath for clay golems. only gremlin

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Extrinsic properties that resist a given damage type protect the target's inventory from that damage 99⁄100 of the time, and a worn dwarvish cloak prevents inventory damage from fire and cold attacks 9⁄10 of the time.

Per commit 017a8687, the illness attack types and the attack types unique to each Rider are made functional in monster-to-monster combat.

History

In NetHack 3.4.3 and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, magic cancellation has higher probabilities for blocking the effects of certain damage types - in particular, MC3 blocks 49⁄50 or 98% of damage types that it affects, making it an incredibly desirable and reliable property to have.

NetHack 3.6.0 introduces the current magic cancellation system and applies the following changes to damage types:[2]

  • Half physical damage blocks more instances of physical damage than it did in NetHack 3.4.3.
  • Grease protects against all types of erosion.
  • Passive fire damage may burn the attacker's weapon.
  • Passive attacks no longer erode armor covered by other armor.
  • AD_DREN implemented, actually draining energy (energy vortices).

NetHack 3.6.1 applies the following changes to damage types:[3]

  • The AD_SAMU damage type is given the ability to take any quest artifact, rather than just the one corresponding to the hero's role.

NetHack 3.6.2 applies the following changes to damage types:[4]

  • If hero survives sliming via lifesaving, hero continues adventuring in slime form.
  • If AD_TLPT succeeds in teleporting, hit point damage is limited so that defender will not die from hit point loss.

NetHack 3.6.3 applies the following changes to damage types:[5]

  • AD_LEGS no longer fails to deal damage against a target that is flying, levitating or riding as in previous versions.

References

  1. ↑ include/monattk.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 31
  2. ↑ doc/fixes36.0 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1
  3. ↑ doc/fixes36.1 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1
  4. ↑ doc/fixes36.2 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1
  5. ↑ doc/fixes36.3 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1

rawPage:
{{Tocright}}
Every attack in ''[[NetHack]]'' has a defined '''damage type''' that determines how the attack of a [[monster]] or character affects the target when it hits.{{refsrc|include/monattk.h|31|nethack=3.6.7}} This is distinct from the [[attack type]], which determines how that attack makes contact with the target. Many damage types naturally deal [[hit point]] damage, and several have additional effects beyond that damage, which can include inflicting status [[properties]] on the target or affecting items in their open inventory—several do not deal hit point damage, and will instead apply different effects depending on the damage type.

[[Magic cancellation]] can negate the effects of some damage types, and the attacks of [[Cancellation#Cancellation of monsters|cancelled]] monsters with certain damage types will have no effect.

==Cancellation and damage types==
If the attacker is cancelled, then several attack types are blocked, and most special damage types are blocked—cancellation is effective if ''either'' the attack type ''or'' the damage type are blocked. For example, if a dragon is cancelled, its breath attack cannot be used and will do no damage, regardless of the damage type.

These damage types are ''not'' blocked: ordinary physical damage, magic missile, disintegration, digestion, drain intelligence, illness, the [[Riders]]' special damage types, and the Amulet-stealing damage type.

==Magic cancellation and damage types==
[[Magic cancellation]] (not to be confused with cancellation) has a probability of blocking the effects of certain attack and damage types, and is only effective if the attack has ''both'' an eligible [[attack type]] ''and'' an eligible damage type. And even then, there is only a probability of blocking the attack.

These damage types are eligible for magic cancellation: fire, cold, sleep, shock, poison (versus strength, versus dexterity and versus constitution), slow, paralysis, drain life, drain energy, sticking, teleport, lycanthropy, sliming, and disenchanting.

==List of damage types==
{{todo|Linkify the remaining unlinked attack types, creating articles where necessary.}}
Below is a list of damage types and their effects, as well as whether or not they are affected by cancellation or magic cancellation:

Against a monster, it prevents them from using magical attacks or breath weapons for several turns. || ''only'' [[energy vortex]]

|AD_LEGS || [[Wounded legs]] ||

Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. || ''only'' [[lichen]], [[violet fungus]], [[large mimic]], [[giant mimic]]
|-
|AD_SGLD || [[Steal gold]] ||
| The attacker steals some or all of the defender's gold, then teleports if the theft is successful. Against the hero, the attacker may also snatch the gold that the hero was standing on. || ''only'' [[leprechaun]]

|-
|AD_RUST || [[Rust]] ||
| Causes a random piece of worn armor to rust, which may fail if it is blessed, rustproof or not rustable. As a passive attack, it tries to rust the gear that made contact. Instadeath for [[iron golem]]s. || ''only'' [[gray ooze]], [[rust monster]]
|-
|AD_CONF || [[Confusion]] ||
| Deals no hit point damage and confuses the defender. || ''only'' [[umber hulk]], [[Yeenoghu]]
|-
|AD_DGST || [[Digestion]] || [[Slow digestion]]
| Against the hero, it [[engulf]]s them and starts a delayed instadeath. Against a monster, it is an immediate instadeath if they are small enough, and otherwise deals physical damage. || ''only'' [[trapper]], [[lurker above]], [[purple worm]]
|-
|AD_HEAL || [[Healing]] ||
| Against the hero, it deals physical damage unless they are wearing no armor and wielding no weapon, in which case multiple positive effects occur, including healing the hero and raising their maximum HP. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. || ''only'' [[nurse]]
|-
|AD_WRAP || [[Holding attack|holding]] / [[Drowning attack|Drowning]] || [[Greased]] armor or [[oilskin cloak]]
| Against the hero, it grabs on the first hit, the attacker swings itself around the hero. On the second hit, if the attacker is in water, the hero [[drown]]s in an instadeath. Against a monster: damage is ordinary physical. || [[eel]]s, [[kraken]], [[python]]
|-
|AD_WERE || [[Lycanthropy]] || [[Protection from shape changers]] or wielding [[Werebane]]
| Against the hero, it causes lycanthropy. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. || ''only'' [[werecreature]]s
|-
|AD_DRDX || [[Poison]] vs [[dexterity]] || [[Poison resistance]]
| Against the hero, it may lower [[dexterity]], and has a chance of causing instadeath. Against a monster, it deals HP damage and may cause instadeath. || ''only'' [[quasit]]
|-
|AD_DRCO || [[Poison]] vs [[constitution]] || [[Poison resistance]]
| Against the hero, it may lower [[constitution]], may cause instadeath. Against a monster, it deals HP damage and may cause instadeath. || ''only'' [[rabid rat]]

| Against the hero, it lowers [[intelligence]] if not blocked, can additionally cause [[amnesia]], and causes an instadeath if their intelligence is drained enough. Against a monster, it deals HP damage, and deals extra damage if the defender is not [[mindless]]. || ''only'' [[mind flayer]], [[master mind flayer]]

|AD_DISE || [[Illness]] || [[Immunity to sickness]]
| Against the hero, it causes illness, which may cause delayed instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect. || ''only'' [[Scorpius]], [[Juiblex]], [[Demogorgon]]

| Against the hero and monsters, it rots a random piece of worn armor; as a passive attack, it rots the item that made contact. Instadeath for [[wood golem]]s and [[leather golem]]s. || ''only'' [[brown pudding]]

| No hit point damage. Against the hero, it initiates a seduction attack; this is changed to AD_DRLI if [[sysconf]] option SEDUCE is not set. May cause an indirect instadeath under certain circumstances by removing certain armor or [[ring]]s. Against a monster, it behaves the same as a normal item-stealing attack. || ''only'' [[incubus]] and [[succubus]]

| No hit point damage. Against the hero, it causes hallucination. Against a monster, it causes [[confusion]]. || ''only'' [[black light]]

| Against the hero, it deals damage to both current and maximum hit points, and may cause an instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect. || ''only'' [[Death]]
|-

| Against the hero, it causes [[illness]], which may cause a delayed instadeath. Against a monster, it has no effect. || ''only'' [[Pestilence]]

| Against the hero, it may cause delayed instadeath by sliming. Against a monster, it may cause an instant transformation into a green slime.|| ''only'' [[green slime]]
|-
|AD_ENCH || Disenchanting ||
| Against the hero, it attempts to disenchant one item. As a passive attack, it disenchants the item that made contact. Against a monster, it deals ordinary physical damage. || ''only'' [[disenchanter]]
|-
|AD_CORR || [[Corrosion]] ||
| Corrodes one item. As a passive attack, it corrodes the item that made contact. || ''only'' [[black pudding]]
|-
|AD_CLRC || [[Monster spell#Clerical spells|Clerical spell]] || 
| Against the hero, the attacker casts a clerical spell appropriate to the attacker's level. Against a monster, it has no effect. || [[aligned priest]], [[high priest]], [[Master Kaen]]
|-
|AD_SPEL || [[Monster spell#Mage spells|Mage spell]] ||
| Against the hero, the attacker casts a mage spell appropriate to the attacker's level, which may include the [[touch of death]]. Against a monster, it has no effect. || [[lich]], [[orc shaman]], [[Wizard of Yendor]]
|-
|AD_RBRE || Random [[breath weapon]] ||
| This damage type resolves to a random damage type between AD_MAGM and AD_ACID. || ''only'' the [[Chromatic Dragon]]
|- 
|AD_SAMU || Steal the Amulet ||
| Against the hero, the attacker steals a valuable item such as the [[Amulet of Yendor]], any other [[unique item]], or any [[quest artifact]]. Against a monster, it has no effect. || ''only'' [[quest nemeses]], the [[Wizard of Yendor]]
|-
|AD_CURS || Steal intrinsic ||
| Against the hero, it removes a random [[intrinsic]] from them. Against a monster, it may cancel the defender. Instadeath for [[clay golem]]s. || ''only'' [[gremlin]]
|}

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Extrinsic properties that resist a given damage type protect the target's inventory from that damage {{frac|99|100}} of the time, and a worn [[dwarvish cloak]] prevents inventory damage from fire and cold attacks {{frac|9|10}} of the time.

Per {{commit|017a8687e0b541a8e5848ef3037e25dc819208ca}}, the illness attack types and the attack types unique to each Rider are made functional in monster-to-monster combat.}}

==History==
In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, [[Magic cancellation (3.4.3)|magic cancellation]] has higher probabilities for blocking the effects of certain damage types - in particular, MC3 blocks {{frac|49|50}} or 98% of damage types that it affects, making it an incredibly desirable and reliable property to have.

[[NetHack 3.6.0]] introduces the current magic cancellation system and applies the following changes to damage types:{{refsrc|doc/fixes36.0|1|nethack=3.6.7}}
* [[Half physical damage]] blocks more instances of physical damage than it did in NetHack 3.4.3.
* Grease protects against all types of [[erosion]].
* [[Passive]] fire damage may burn the attacker's weapon.
* Passive attacks no longer erode armor covered by other armor.
* <tt>AD_DREN</tt> implemented, actually draining energy (energy vortices).

[[NetHack 3.6.1]] applies the following changes to damage types:{{refsrc|doc/fixes36.1|1|nethack=3.6.7}}
* The <tt>AD_SAMU</tt> damage type is given the ability to take any quest artifact, rather than just the one corresponding to the hero's role.

[[NetHack 3.6.2]] applies the following changes to damage types:{{refsrc|doc/fixes36.2|1|nethack=3.6.7}}
* If hero survives [[sliming]] via [[lifesaving]], hero continues adventuring in slime form.
* If <tt>AD_TLPT</tt> succeeds in teleporting, hit point damage is limited so that defender will not die from hit point loss.

[[NetHack 3.6.3]] applies the following changes to damage types:{{refsrc|doc/fixes36.3|1|nethack=3.6.7}}
* <tt>AD_LEGS</tt> no longer fails to deal damage against a target that is [[flying]], [[levitating]] or [[riding]] as in previous versions.
